properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 9:42PM PST until January 18 at 5:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...ANOTHER WINTER STORM SYSTEM TONIGHT AND SATURDAY...

.The next winter storm system will spread light snow over the
area starting tonight. Snow will intensify Saturday morning
before tapering off in the late afternoon. Heavy snow
accumulations are possible in the Cascades and adjacent Columbia
Basin areas as well as the Okanogan Highlands.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8
inches in the valleys and 8 to 16 inches in the mountains.

* WHERE...Stevens Pass, Leavenworth, Mazama, Stehekin, Blewett
Pass, Loup Loup Pass, Plain, Telma, and Holden Village.

* WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 5 PM PST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional snow on top of trees already
weighed down by recent snowfall may result in downed trees,
power outages, and road closures.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PST SATURDAY
